label: Asset bubble
description: Unsustainably overpriced assets such as commodities, housing, shares, etc. in a major economy or region.

label: Deflation
description: Prolonged ultra-low inflation or deflation in a major economy or region.

label: Failure of financial mechanism or institution
description: Collapse of a financial institution and/or malfunctioning of a financial system impacts the global economy.

label: Failure of critical infrastructure
description: Failure to adequately invest in, upgrade and secure infrastructure networks (e.g. energy, transportation and communications) leads to pressure or a breakdown with system-wide implications.

label: Fiscal crises
description: Excessive debt burdens generate sovereign debt crises and/or liquidity crises.

label: Unemployment or underemployment
description: A sustained high level of unemployment or underutilization of the productive capacity of the employed population prevents the economy from attaining high levels of employment.

label: Illicit trade
description: Large-scale activities outside the legal framework such as illicit financial flow, tax evasion, human trafficking, counterfeiting and organized crime undermine social interactions, regional or international collaboration and global growth.

label: Energy price shock
description: Energy price increases or decreases significantly and places further economic pressures on highly energy-dependent industries and consumers.

label: Unmanageable inflation
description: Unmanageable increase in the general price level of goods and services in key economies.

label: Extreme weather events
description: Major property, infrastructure and environmental damage as well as human loss caused by extreme weather events.

label: Failure of climate-change mitigation and adaptation
description: Governments and businesses fail to enforce or enact effective measures to mitigate climate change, protect populations and help businesses impacted by climate change to adapt.

label: Biodiversity loss and ecosystem collapse
description: Irreversible consequences for the environment, resulting in severely depleted resources for humankind as well as industries.

label: Natural catastrophes
description: Major property, infrastructure and environmental damage as well as human loss caused by geophysical disasters such as earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, tsunamis or geomagnetic storms.

label: Man-made environmental catastrophes
description: Failure to prevent major man-made catastrophes, causing harm to lives, human health, infrastructure, property, economic activity and the environment.

label: Failure of national governance
description: Inability to govern a nation of geopolitical importance due to weak rule of law, corruption or political deadlock.

label: Interstate conflict
description: A bilateral or multilateral dispute between states escalates into economic (e.g. trade/currency wars, resource nationalization), military, cyber, societal or other conflict.

label: Terrorist attacks
description: Individuals or non-state groups with political or religious goals successfully inflict large-scale human or material damage.

label: State collapse or crisis
description: State collapse of geopolitical importance due to internal violence, regional or global instability, military coup, civil conflict, failed states, etc.

label: Weapons of mass destruction
description: Nuclear, chemical, biological and radiological technologies and materials are deployed creating international crises and potential for significant destruction.

label: Failure of urban planning
description: Poorly planned cities, urban sprawl and associated infrastructure create social, environmental and health challenges.

label: Food crises
description: Access to appropriate quantities and quality of food and nutrition becomes inadequate, unaffordable or unreliable on a major scale.

label: Large-scale involuntary migration
description: Large-scale involuntary migration induced by conflict, disasters, environmental or economic reasons.

label: Profound social instability
description: Major social movements or protests (e.g. street riots, social unrest, etc.) disrupt political or social stability, negatively impacting populations and economic activity.

label: Spread of infectious diseases
description: Bacteria, viruses, parasites or fungi cause uncontrolled spread of infectious diseases (for instance due to resistance to antibiotics, antivirals and other treatments) leading to widespread fatalities and economic disruption.

label: Water crises
description: A significant decline in the available quality and quantity of fresh water resulting in harmful effects on human health and/or economic activity.

label: Adverse consequences of technological advances
description: Intended or unintended adverse consequences of technological advances such as artificial intelligence, geo-engineering and synthetic biology causing human, environmental and economic damage.

label: Critical information infrastructure breakdown
description: Cyber dependency increases vulnerability to outage of critical information infrastructure (e.g. internet, satellites, etc.) and networks causing widespread disruption.

label: Cyberattacks
description: Large-scale cyberattacks or malware causing large economic damages, geopolitical tensions or widespread loss of trust in the Internet.

label: Data fraud or theft
description: Wrongful exploitation of private or official data that takes place on an unprecedented scale.

label: Ageing population
description: Ageing populations in developed and developing countries driven by declining fertility and decrease of middle and old age mortality.

label: Changing landscape of international governance
description: Changing landscape of global or regional institutions (e.g.  UN, IMF, NATO, etc.), agreements or networks.

label: Climate change
description: Change of climate which is attributed directly or indirectly to human activity that alters the composition of the global atmosphere, in addition to natural climate variability.

label: Environmental degradation
description: Deterioration in the quality of air, soil and water from ambient concentrations of pollutants and other activities and processes.

label: Growing middle class in emerging economies
description: Growing share of population reaching middle-class income levels in emerging economies.

label: Increasing national sentiment
description: Increasing national sentiment among populations and political leaders affecting countries’ national and international political positions.

label: Increasing polarization of societies
description: Inability to reach agreement on key issues within countries because of diverging or extreme values, political or religious views.

label: Rise of chronic diseases
description: Increasing rates of non-communicable diseases, also known as chronic diseases, leading to long-term costs of treatment and threatening recent societal gains in life expectancy and quality.

label: Rise of cyber dependency
description: Rise of cyber dependency due to increasing digital interconnection of people, things and organizations.

label: Rising geographic mobility
description: Increasing mobility of people and things due to quicker and better-performing means of transport and lowered regulatory barriers.

label: Rising income and wealth disparity
description: Increasing socioeconomic gap between rich and poor in major countries or regions.

label: Shifts in power
description: Shifting power from state to non-state actors and individuals, from global to regional levels, and from developed to emerging market and developing economies.

label: Urbanization
description: Rising number of people living in urban areas resulting in physical growth of cities.
